Begin by calling the CEOs of some Republican contributors and tell them unless you get the congress to raise the minimum wage, you will no longer buy their products.
 
 You can begin by calling the CEO of Dell Computers, Exxon/Mobil, General Electric, Walmart, Wendy's, Outback Steakhouse, Olive Garden and Red Lobster.

post_info.post_title: Help us force congress to raise the minimum wage.

At least some of the corporations you mentioned are already lobbying congress to raise the minimum wage, I know walmart certainly is. They already pay more than the minimum wage, so the rise won't directly affect them.
 
 But if they raise it they can drive smaller competitors who can't afford it (but have other benefits in place which already attract employees such as proximity to home and a relaxed working style) out of business, and thereby increase their market share.
Labor unions will also be most grateful you made the call. They use the minimum wage as comparison to increase their bloated compensation package.

Good luck in a republican controlled congress. Republicans don't care about the poor. Haven't you learned republicans are only intrested in forcing religious values on people and making the rich richer.

Begin by calling the CEOs of some Republican contributors and tell them unless you get the congress to raise the minimum wage, you will no longer buy their products.
 
 You can begin by calling the CEO of Dell Computers, Exxon/Mobil, General Electric, Walmart, Wendy's, Outback Steakhouse, Olive Garden and Red Lobster.
 _________________
 http://www.buyblue.biz
 
 http://redambition.ws
 
 http://www.zazzle.com/maximus7
 
 http://www.cafepress.com/revolution09

 
 Why? Do you want to make their burgers, fries and beer more expensive?

Labor unions will also be most grateful you made the call. They use the minimum wage as comparison to increase their bloated compensation package.

 
 And let's not forget organized labor's plum is now government workers, with automatic CPI increases dependent on which way that wind blows.

Please tell us how you can affect anyone's position in the economy by raising the price of (low end) labor without holding all other prices constant. The only wage that counts is the real wage - the number of goods that any given wage can purchase. With no minimum wage, entry level jobs will pay about one lunch at McDonalds per hour. With a high minimum wage, prices will soon rise so that one hour of entry level labor will still only get you a lunch at McDonalds. It has always been thus. Make a proposal that means something.
